Nest all commits by each pattern

Source: R/utils.R
nest_commits_by_pattern.Rd

Nest all commits by each pattern

nest_commits_by_pattern(
  repo,
  pattern = c(Issues = "#[[:digit:]]+"),
  ref = "master",
  silent = TRUE
)

Arguments

repo

a path to a repository or a git_repository object. Default is '.'
pattern

Named vector of regex patterns
ref

The name of a reference to list commits from e.g. a tag or a branch. The default is NULL for the current branch.
silent

Logical. Whether to hide messages.

Examples

repo <- fake_repo()
nest_commits_by_pattern(repo, pattern = )
#> # A tibble: 6 x 5
#>   pattern.type pattern.content   pattern_numeric link_pattern data             
#>   <chr>        <chr>                       <dbl> <chr>        <list>           
#> 1 Issues       #1                              1 aissues-1    <tibble [2 × 11]>
#> 2 Issues       #2                              2 aissues-2    <tibble [1 × 11]>
#> 3 Issues       #12                            12 aissues-12   <tibble [1 × 11]>
#> 4 Issues       #32                            32 aissues-32   <tibble [1 × 11]>
#> 5 Issues       #145                          145 aissues-145  <tibble [1 × 11]>
#> 6 Issues       No related issues              NA aissues-na   <tibble [1 × 11]>
